I1.1_articulation_clarity.name: Articulation Clarity
I1.1_articulation_clarity.description: Percentage of interviewees who can clearly articulate the problem
I1.1_articulation_clarity.data_source: Q1, Q8 responses in tracking template
I1.1_articulation_clarity.calculation_method: Count interviews where problem was clearly described with specifics / Total interviews

I1.2_problem_frequency.name: Problem Frequency
I1.2_problem_frequency.description: Percentage reporting problem occurs at least weekly
I1.2_problem_frequency.calculation_method: Count interviews with >=weekly occurrence / Total interviews

I1.3_problem_severity.name: Problem Severity
I1.3_problem_severity.description: Average pain score reported by interviewees
I1.3_problem_severity.calculation_method: Sum of all pain scores / Total interviews

I1.4_current_workarounds.name: Current Workarounds
I1.4_current_workarounds.description: Percentage using workarounds with significant gaps
I1.4_current_workarounds.calculation_method: Count interviews with incomplete/unsatisfactory workarounds / Total interviews

I1.5_competitive_awareness.name: Competitive Landscape Awareness
I1.5_competitive_awareness.calculation_method: Count interviews mentioning competitive alternatives / Total interviews

I1.6_solution_resonance.name: Solution Resonance
I1.6_solution_resonance.calculation_method: Count interviews with positive reaction and >=50% use case fit / Total interviews

I1.7_competitive_displacement.name: Competitive Displacement
I1.7_competitive_displacement.description: Percentage who would replace existing tools/processes
I1.7_competitive_displacement.calculation_method: Count interviews indicating tool/spend displacement / Total interviews

I1.8_budget_available.name: Budget Availability
I1.8_budget_available.description: Percentage with budget authority and current relevant spend
I1.8_budget_available.calculation_method: Count interviews with budget authority and >=10K current spend / Total interviews

I1.9_willingness_to_pay.name: Willingness to Pay (Optimal Range)
I1.9_willingness_to_pay.calculation_method: Aggregate Van Westendorp curves to find optimal range

I1.10_purchase_intent.name: Purchase Intent
I1.10_purchase_intent.description: Average purchase intent and percentage with high intent
I1.10_purchase_intent.calculation_method: Sum of all purchase intent scores / Total interviews

notes.instructions: This KPI file will be populated by the analyzer agent after interviews are completed. The founder should focus on conducting interviews and filling out the tracking template. Once 10-15 interviews are complete, the analyzer will calculate all KPI values and determine pass/fail status.
